page.title: 05Sharnbrook Lower School
page.content: In 1836 a fund was set up to start a {National Day School}in Sharnbrook; a year later a room, which is still used by the school, was let to the committee by Admiral Gambier. In 1868 {Goverment inspectors}began to take an interest in the school, and in 1870 the{School Board}was set up, more land bought, and a master's house and new school were built. This was the first county school to be set up in Bedfordshire. New buildings were added to{'John Gibbard School'}in 1968 and 1975. Today there are five classes, a staffroom, a hall, a library, a nature reserve and a resources room. There are 115 children in the school, and 50 of them have{school dinners. The children, aged 5-9,transfer to {Margaret Beaufort School,Riseley,}in the September following their 9th. birthday.
